Actions to promote iron supplementation for menstruating women
■■ Intermittent iron and folic acid supplementation is a preventive strategy for implementation 
at population level. If a woman is diagnosed as having anaemia in a clinical setting, she 
should be treated with daily iron (120 mg of elemental iron) and folic acid (400 μ g or 0.4 mg) 
supplementation until her haemoglobin concentration rises to normal. She can then switch to
